p: In conclusion, among patients with COVID-19-associated AIS, those who had received prior vaccination for COVID-19 had lower risk of mortality and complications for intracranial hemorrhage, venous thromboembolism and acute myocardial infarction compared to those who did not have prior vaccination for COVID-19. Vaccination against COVID-19 should be encouraged, particularly in the population of patients who are at higher risk of having a stroke. Even if vaccination against COVID-19 does not eliminate the risk of infection, the findings here demonstrate that vaccination is associated with a significant reduction in morbidity and mortality in the event of COVID-19-associated AIS.
